page.title: 13ATTERCLIFFE MEMORIES
page.content: The{Attercliffe}area has changed drastically, even just in the last thirty years. Then the area was covered with steel works and terraced housing with outside toilets. Most of the works are closed now and derelict. When I was young men finished work at 5.30 and poured out of the mills, filling the streets. There was not much unemployment, you could change jobs quite easily. Local shops stayed open later so that people go in after work. There was a pub or{'beer-off' (off-licence)on every corner_ it was thirsty work in the steel mills. There were also a lot of picture houses. They have now changed to 'Bingo' halls, or become the sites for supermarkets or petrol stations. It was possible to see a different film every night in Attercliffe.
